text: Sprinkler system type (wet, dry, pre-action) matches design scope and NFPA classification
Submittals reviewed and stamped by certified engineer (referencing NFPA 13, 25, local AHJ)
Hazard classification confirmed per occupancy (Light, OH-1, OH-2, Special Hazard, Lab) as per HMS & NFPA 13
Hydraulic calculations include 10 PSI safety margin, flow data current and traceable
Drawings include clear hydraulic reference points, compliant to AHJ and site-specific layout
UL/FM listed sprinkler heads, risers, valves, pressure gauges, tamper switches, and alarms confirmed
System piping verified per spec: Sched 40 black steel, grooved/cut per manufacturer, no torch-cutting
Isolation valves (OS&Y) accessible and clearly tagged with supervision where required
Sprinkler head spacing, elevation, and clearances verified per NFPA 13 and ceiling condition
Pipe hangers and seismic bracing installed per NFPA 13, ANSI/AWWA and manufacturer's instructions
Pressure-reducing valves and relief piping installed and adjusted per location requirements
Air vents and flushing valves installed at system high/low points (for wet/dry systems)
Hydrostatic test: 200 psi for 2 hours successfully passed and documented
Flow switches, tamper switches, pressure alarms triggered correctly
Main drain test completed; pressure drop within acceptable differential
Trip test completed (for dry or pre-action) with full reset and drain documented
Preaction panels tested for initiating circuits and functionality
System tagged with updated hydraulic demand placards, head lists, and zone maps
Life Safety Records binder provided with inspection logs (initial/annual/monthly per NFC-AE 2019)
Inspection, Testing, and Maintenance forms completed (per CAN/ULC-S536, NFPA 25, Section 21 01 90B)
AHJ and insurance inspections passed, certificates submitted
